title.rendered: India Women vs Australia Women, 5th T20I: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

India: Smriti Mandhana, Shafali Verma, Jemimah Rodrigues/Sabbhineni Meghana, Harmanpreet Kaur (c), Devika Vaidya, Richa Ghosh (wk), Harleen Deol, Deepti Sharma, Radha Yadav, Anjali Sarvani/Rajeswari Gayakwad, Renuka Thakur Singh

Australia: Alyssa Healy (c), Beth Mooney (wk), Tahlia McGrath, Ellyse Perry, Ashleigh Gardner, Grace Harris, Annabel Sutherland, Heather Graham, Alana King, Megan Schutt, Darcie Brown

Pitch Report

Venue: Brabourne Stadium

(Based on the last 2 games)

1st innings average score: 180

2nd innings average score: 166

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Excellent for batting.

Weather: Clear.

Wins

Batting 1st: 100%

Batting 2nd: —

Fantasy Tips of the Day

Although the pitch has favoured the batters, the spinners have had a good time too. 13 of 23 wickets that fell in the last 2 games belonged to the spinners.

5 of the top 7 wicket-takers in the series are all-rounders.

Smart Picks

The wicketkeepers from both teams have been making the life of fantasy players easier. While Richa Ghosh appeared in the Ultimate Team in all four games in the series, Alyssa Healy has collected 60 points with the help of 93 runs, a catch, and a stumping.

Beth Mooney is the only player to collect fantasy points in three figures: 145. Besides adding 203 runs at a strike rate of 144, she has provided vital points for 3 catches and a stumping. Not to forget that she was the top run-scorer in the Australian T20 League: 434 runs at an average of 44.

At the venue, Ellyse Perry has scores 75 off 47 and 72* off 42. Against India, she averages 31 in 24 games. With the ball, however, she has not been utilised much but managed to pick 2 wickets in only 5 overs.

Smriti Mandhana has been in good touch in 2022, blasting 590 runs at an average of 35. On the other hand, Shafali Verma has got starts in all the games, providing bonus points for a thirty and a fifty.

4 of Deepti Sharma’s 5 wickets in the series have come at the Brabourne Stadium. With the bat, she has been even better, having a top score of 36*.

Ashleigh Gardner has been impressive with both bat and ball of late. In her last 10 competitive T20s, she has taken 14 wickets and smashed 236 runs at an average of 34.
